meanings.definition: To surround or blockade an area with a line of people or objects.
meanings.sent1: The police were cordoning off the crime scene to keep everyone safe.
meanings.sent2: During the parade, the officers were cordoning the street to control the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended they were cordoning off their secret hideout from intruders.
meanings.sent4: She felt like cordoning her heart from any more pain after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The firefighters were cordoning the burning building to prevent the flames from spreading.

meanings.definition: A line of people or objects used to surround or blockade an area.
meanings.sent1: The cordoning around the VIP section kept unauthorized people out.
meanings.sent2: The protestors formed a cordoning to prevent anyone from entering the building.
meanings.sent3: The cordoning of teddy bears around the sleeping child was a cute sight.
meanings.sent4: The cordoning of trees around the garden gave it a magical feel.
meanings.sent5: The cordoning of books on the shelf made the library look organized.
